title: C$\cdot$ASE: Learning Conditional Adversarial Skill Embeddings for Physics-based Characters. (arXiv:2309.11351v1 [cs.GR])
abstract: We present C$\cdot$ASE, an efficient and effective framework that learns conditional Adversarial Skill Embeddings for physics-based characters. Our physically simulated character can learn a diverse repertoire of skills while providing controllability in the form of direct manipulation of the skills to be performed. C$\cdot$ASE divides the heterogeneous skill motions into distinct subsets containing homogeneous samples for training a low-level conditional model to learn conditional behavior distribution. The skill-conditioned imitation learning naturally offers explicit control over the character's skills after training. The training course incorporates the focal skill sampling, skeletal residual forces, and element-wise feature masking to balance diverse skills of varying complexities, mitigate dynamics mismatch to master agile motions and capture more general behavior characteristics, respectively. translated_title: C⋅ASE：学习基于物理的角色的条件对抗技能嵌入
translated_abstract: 我们提出了C⋅ASE，一个高效而有效的框架，用于学习基于物理的角色的条件对抗技能嵌入。我们的物理模拟角色可以学习各种技能，同时提供以直接操纵执行的技能的可控性。C⋅ASE将异构的技能动作划分为包含同质样本的不同子集，用于训练低级条件模型来学习条件行为分布。训练过程中采用了焦点技能采样、骨骼残余力和逐元素特征屏蔽，以平衡不同复杂性的各种技能，减轻动力学不匹配以掌握敏捷动作，并捕捉更多的一般行为特征。一旦训练完成，条件模型就可以生成高度多样且逼真的技能。
tldr: C⋅ASE是一个学习基于物理的角色的条件对抗技能嵌入的框架，通过将异构的技能动作划分为不同子集，以实现多样性和可控性。训练过程中采用了焦点技能采样、骨骼残余力和逐元素特征屏蔽，以平衡不同复杂性的技能，并捕捉更一般的行为特征。
en_tdlr: C⋅ASE is a framework for learning conditional adversarial skill embeddings for physics-based characters. It divides heterogeneous skill motions into subsets, allowing for diversity and controllability. The training process incorporates focal skill sampling, skeletal residual forces, and element-wise feature masking to balance skill complexities and capture more general behavior characteristics.
